thread.title: Paris' first skyscraper in over 40 years
thread.title_full: Paris' first skyscraper in over 40 years

author: Staff Reporter
title: Paris' first skyscraper in over 40 years
text:
Paris' first skyscraper in over 40 years Article By: Staff Reporter Thu, 02 Jul 2015 5:19 PM Share Your Email Credit: Tour Triangle/Facebook 
Paris will be getting its first skyscraper in over 40 years - much to the disappointment of many locals. 
The Tour Triangle - or Triangle Tower - has been approved for construction, despite hearty opposition to the project, MailOnline reported. 
The skyscraper, set to be completed in 2018, will be situated in Porte de Versailles. 
It will include a 120-room hotel along with office space. 
According to MailOnline, this will be the first time since 1973 that a skyscraper will be built in Paris. 
The first (and last) Parisian skyscraper built was the Tour Montparnasse, which still gets complaints of being an eyesore. 
Pictures of the planned Tour Triangle were posted on Facebook . Have a look at some of them below:
